<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY:
inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">REASON FOR AMENDMENT</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT:
36pt"></font>The sole purpose of this Amendment to the Quarterly Report on Form 
10-Q of EnXnet, Inc. for the period ended June 30, 2012, filed with the 
Securities and Exchange Commission (&#8220;SEC&#8221;) on August 14, 2012, is to
furnish Exhibit 101 to the Form 10-Q in accordance with Rule 405(a)(2) of 
Regulation S-T. Exhibit 101 consists of the interactive data files that were not
included with the Form 10-Q, as allowed by the 30-day grace period for the first
quarterly period in which detailed footnote tagging is required. This amendment 
does not otherwise change or update the disclosures set forth in the Form 10-Q 
as originally filed and does not otherwise reflect events occurring after the 
original filing of the Form 10-Q.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:

1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ENXNET, 
INC</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-

<tr>
<td align="left" valign="bottom" width="54%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>

TRANSACTIONS:</font></div>

<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ENXNET, 
INC</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><a 
name="Notes"><!--EFPlaceholder--></a>NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">(Unaudited)</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NOTE 1 - 
BASIS OF PRESENTATION</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The accompanying unaudited 
financial statements of EnXnet, Inc. (&#8220;EnXnet&#8221; or &#8220;the 
Company&#8221;) for the three months ended June 30, 2012 have been prepared in 
accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States of
America, pursuant to the rules and regulations of the U.S. Securities and 
Exchange Comission (the &#8220;SEC&#8221;) for interim financia1 
information.&#160;Accordingly, the financial statements do not include all 
information and footnotes required by generally accepted accounting principles 
in the United States (&#8220;GAAP&#8221;) for complete annual financial 
statements.&#160;In the opinion of management, the accompanying unaudited 
condensed interim financial statements reflect all adjustments, consisting of 
normal recurring adjustments, considered necessary for a fair 
presentation.&#160;The accompanying financial statements should be read in 
conjunction with the financial statements and notes thereto included in the 
Company&#8217;s March 31, 2012 Annual Report on Form 10-K.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NOTE 2 
&#8211; GOING CONCERN</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The Company has a working 
capital deficit and has incurred losses since inception. &#160;These factors 
raise substantial doubt about the Company&#8217;s ability to continue as a going
concern. &#160;The financial statements do not include any adjustments that may 
be necessary if the Company is unable to continue as a going 
concern.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Management of the Company has 
undertaken certain actions to address these conditions. &#160;Management is 
currently in negotiations with potential customers and with marketing 
representatives to establish a more developed product channel. &#160;Funds 
required to carry out management&#8217;s plans are expected to be derived from 
future stock sales and borrowings from outside parties. &#160;There can be no 
assurances that the Company will be successful in executing its 
plans.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NOTE 3 
&#8211; CONVERTIBLE NOTES PAYABLE</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NOTE 4 
&#8211; ADVANCES FROM AND NOTES PAYABLE TO OFFICER</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Advances from a stockholder at 
both June 30, 2012 and March 31, 2012 were $32,400.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Our CEO, Ryan Corley, has made 
advances to the Company in prior years. During the three months ended June 30, 
2012, the CEO made additional unsecured advances totaling $18,900. During the 
three months ended June 30, 2012 the Company made payments on these advances of 
$11,000. On May 17, 2012, advances in the amount of $36,900 were converted into 
a note payable bearing interest at 2% and convertible into common stock of the 
Company at $0.08 per share.</font></div>
<br>

RIGHT: 0pt">

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ENXNET, 
INC</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NOTES TO 
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">(Unaudited)</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The Company has notes payable 
to the CEO totaling $642,455 and $605,555 as of June 30, 2012 and March 31, 
2012. Accrued interest owed on these notes is $125,814 and $122,670. These notes
and accrued interest are convertible into 13,899,258 and 13,372,992 shares, 
respectively.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">An entity controlled by the CEO
has made unsecured advances and notes payables to the Company. At both June 30, 
2012 and March 31, 2012, advances from the entity controlled by the CEO were 
$10,500 with notes payable totaled $160,250. Accrued interest owed on these 
notes was $13,213 and $12,136, respectively. These notes and accrued interest 
are convertible into 2,797,773 and 2,780,783 shares, respectively.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NOTE 5 - 
COMMON STOCK TRANSACTIONS</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The Company issued 250,000 
shares in exchange for services valued at $7,500 for the three months ended June
30, 2012. The Company also issued 1,250,000 shares for $50,000 in cash during 
the three months ended June 30, 2012.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NOTE 6 
&#8211; STOCK OPTIONS</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">On July 24, 2001, the Company 
filed with the SEC Form S-8, for its 2002 Stock Option Plan, (the Plan). An 
aggregate amount of common stock that may be awarded and purchased under the 
Plan is 3,000,000 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock. Under the Plan 
during the years ended March 31, 2012, the Company granted stock options to 
employees and members of the Board of Directors in the amount of 2,190,000. The 
Company recognized option expense of $4,453 due to the vesting of these 
options.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">There were no stock options

below:</font></div>

SUBSEQUENT EVENTS</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">On July 1, 2012, the Company 
issued to its new Executive Vice President, 100,000 shares and an option to 
purchase 200,000 shares at $0.25 per share. This option expires on the earlier 
of 3 years from the grant date or 90 days after the resignation of the Executive
Vice President.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">On July 18, 2012, the Company sold 
500,000 shares for $50,000 cash.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 
11pt; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt;">
<td style="WIDTH: 109px">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><a name="Item2"><!--EFPlaceholder--></a><a 
name="Item2MDA"><!--EFPlaceholder--></a>ITEM 2.</font></div>
</td>
<td width="898">
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">MANAGEMENT&#8217;S DISCUSSION AND 
ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">STATEMENT REGARDING FORWARD-
LOOKING STATEMENTS.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">This Quarterly Report includes 
&#8220;forward-looking statements&#8221; within the meaning of Section 27A of 
the Exchange Act which represent the expectations or beliefs concerning future 
events that involve risks and uncertainties, including but not limited to the 
demand for Company products and services and the costs associated with such 
goods and services. All other statements other than statements of historical 
fact included in this Quarterly Report including, without limitation, the 
statements under &#8220;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis or Plan of 
Operations&#8221; and elsewhere in the Quarterly Report, are forward-looking 
statements. &#160;While the Company believes that the expectations reflected in 
such forward-looking statements are reasonable, it can give no assurance that 
such expectations will prove to have been correct.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The following discussion of the
results of operations and financial conditions should be read in conjunction 
with the financial statements and related notes appearing in this 
report.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">EnXnet, Inc. was formed under 
the laws of the State of Oklahoma on March 30, 1999 as Southern Wireless, Inc. 
It is a business and technology development enterprise engaged in the 
development, marketing, and licensing of emerging technologies and innovative 
business strategies and practices, focusing primarily on products, solutions, 
and services that support and enhance multimedia management and green 
environmentally friendly systems for heating and air conditioning 
units.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The Company currently can 
satisfy its current cash requirements for approximately 30 days and has a plan 
to raise additional working capital by the sale of shares of the Company common 
stock to select perspective individuals and from additional borrowings. 
Additionally, holders of outstanding stock options have been exercising those 
options which have provided additional working capital for the Company. This 
plan should provide the additional necessary funds required to enable the 
Company to continue marketing and developing its products until the Company can 
generate enough cash flow from sales to sustain its operations.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The Company does not anticipate
any significant cash requirements for the purchase of any 
facilities.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The Company currently has one 
full-time employee on the payroll. It is anticipated that the Company will need 
to hire additional employees in order to expand the marketing and developing of 
its products. Currently our employee and other outside consultants are used for 
the further development of our products.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Results of 
Operations &#8211; Three months ended June 30, 2012 and 2011.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Revenues have not been 
substantial as we refocused our efforts on developing technologies and 
developing marketing affiliates.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The Company incurred operating 
expenses of $44,996 and $40,983 for the three months ended June 30, 2012 and 
2011, a increase of $4,013 or 10%. The increase in operating expenses of $4,013 
for the three months ended June 30, 2012 when compared to the three month period
ended June 30, 2011 is attributed to:</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Increases in:</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%" style="FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td align="right" style="WIDTH: 36pt">

</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"

<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-
RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 9pt">-8-</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: darkgray" noshade size="3">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 9pt"><a href="#TOC"><!--EFPlaceholder--><font
style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Table of 
Contents</font></a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<br>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The increase in professional 
fees of $9,264 for the three months ended June 30, 2012 compared to the three 
month period ended June 30, 2011 is attributed to an increase in fees for 
auditor related services.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The decrease in consulting 
expenses of $3,908 for the three months ended June 30, 2012 compared to the 
three month period ended June 30, 2011 is related to the amount of restricted 
stock issued to consultants for services to the company. In the three months 
ended June 30, 2012 we recognized consulting expense totaling $8,246 while in 
the three months ended June 30, 2011 we recognized consulting expense totaling 
$14,681.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Other classifications of 
expenses did not fluctuate substantially for the three month period ended June 
30, 2012 compared to the three month period ended June 30, 2011.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">During the three months ended 
June 30, 2012 and 2011 we incurred net losses of $51,019 and $46,584 or $(0.001)
and $(0.001) per share.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Liquidity 
and Capital Resources.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">From inception through June 30,
2012, the Company has issued 46,639,018 shares of its Common Stock to officers, 
directors and outside shareholders. &#160;The Company has little operating 
history and no material assets other than the patents for TAC Unit, ThinDisc, 
Passive Resonant Reflector, and an Antenna for an optical storage disk, EnXcase,
and Disc Security Tag.&#160;&#160;The Company has $32,462 in cash as of June 30,
2012.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The Company has incurred 
operating losses each year since its inception and has had a working capital
deficit at June 30, 2012. At June 30, 2012 and March 31, 2012 the working 
capital deficit was $1,509,116 and $1,520,568, respectively. The working capital
deficit and cash balance raise substantial doubt about the Company&#8217;s 
ability to continue as a going concern. &#160;As a result of these factors, the 
Company&#8217;s independent certified public accountants have included an 
explanatory paragraph in their reports on the Company&#8217;s March 31, 2012 
financial statements which expressed substantial doubt about the Company&#8217;s
ability to continue as a going concern.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Contractual 
Obligations.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">At the present time, the 
Company has no material commitments for capital expenditures.&#160;&#160;If 
capital expenditures are required after operations commence, the Company will 
pay for the same through the sale of common stock, or through loans from third 
parties.&#160;&#160;There is no assurance, however, that such financing will be 
available and in the event such financing is not available, the Company may have
to cease operations.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">CRITICAL ACCOUNTING 
POLICIES AND ESTIMATES.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Management&#8217;s discussion 
and analysis of financial condition and results of operations are based upon our
consolidated financial statements. These statements have been prepared in 
accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States of
America.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Use of 
estimates in preparation of financial statements</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The preparation of financial 
statements in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles requires
management to make certain estimates, judgments and assumptions that affect the 
reported amounts of assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses, and related 
disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities. On an on-going basis, we 
evaluate our estimates, based on historical experience, and various other 
assumptions that are believed to be reasonable under the circumstances, the 
results of which form the basis for making judgments about the carrying values 
of assets and liabilities that are not readily apparent from other sources. 
Actual results may differ from these estimates under different assumptions or 
conditions. The following critical accounting policies rely upon assumptions, 
judgments and estimates and were used in the preparation of our consolidated 
financial statements:</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; 
DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Cash and 
cash equivalents</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Cash equivalents are highly 
liquid investments with an original maturity of three months or 
less.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<br>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-
RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 9pt">-9-</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: darkgray" noshade size="3">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 9pt"><a href="#TOC"><!--EFPlaceholder--><font
style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Table of 
Contents</font></a></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<br>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; 
DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Use of 
estimates</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The preparation of financial 
statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the 
United States necessarily requires management to make estimates and assumptions 
that affect the amounts reported in the financial statements. We regularly 
evaluate estimates and judgments based on historical experience and other 
relevant facts and circumstances. Actual results could differ from those 
estimates.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Fixed 
Assets</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Fixed assets are recorded at 
cost. Depreciation and amortization are provided using the straight-line method 
over the useful lives of the respective assets, typically 3-10 years. Major 
additions and betterments are capitalized. Upon retirement or disposal, the cost
and related accumulated depreciation or amortization is removed from the 
accounts and any gain or loss is reflected in operations.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Depreciation expenses included 
in operating expenses for the three months ended June 30,, 2012 and 2011 were 
$518 and $1452, respectively.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: 
italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Impairment of long-lived 
assets</font> &#8211; The Company reviews the carrying value of its long-lived 
assets annually or whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the
historical-cost carrying value of an asset may no longer be appropriate. The 
Company assesses recoverability of the asset by comparing the undiscounted 
future net cash flows expected to result from the asset to its carrying value. 
If the carrying value exceeds the undiscounted future net cash flows of the 
asset, an impairment loss is measured and recognized. An impairment loss is 
measured as the difference between the net book value and the fair value of the 
long-lived asset. Fair value is estimated based upon either discounted cash flow
analysis or estimated salvage value. As of June 30, 2012, the company recognized
$0 impairment expense.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: 
italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Goodwill and other 
intangibles</font> &#8211; Goodwill and other intangibles with indefinite lives 
are not amortized but are reviewed for impairment at least annually, or more 
frequently if an event or circumstance indicates that an impairment may have 
occurred. To test for impairment, the fair value of each reporting unit is 
compared to the related net book value, including goodwill. If the net book 
value of the reporting unit exceeds the fair value, an impairment loss is 
measured and recognized. An income approach is utilized to estimate the fair 
value of each reporting unit. The income approach is based on the projected 
debt-free cash flow, which is discounted to the present value using discount 
factors that consider the timing and risk of cash flows.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; 
DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
11pt">Licenses</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The costs associated with 
acquiring exclusive licensing rights to patented technology have been 
capitalized and are being charged to expense using the straight line method of 
amortization over ten years, the estimated remaining useful lives of the 
patents.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; 
DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Fair 
Value of Financial Instruments</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Under FASB ASC 825 the Company 
is required to disclose the fair value of financial instruments for which it is 
practicable to estimate value.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The Company&#8217;s financial 
instruments consist of cash, accounts receivable, accounts payable, accrued 
liabilities and debt.&#160;&#160;The Company believes that the carrying amounts 
approximate fair value for all such instruments.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">FASB ASC 820 defines fair 
value, establishes a framework for measurement, and expands disclosure about 
fair value measurements.&#160;&#160;Topic No. 820 defines fair value as the 
price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in
an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (exit
price).&#160;&#160;Topic No. 820 classifies the inputs used to measure fair 
value into the following hierarchy:</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="9%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Level 1:</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="70%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Quoted prices for identical assets or 
liabilities in active markets.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="9%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Level 2:</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="70%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Quoted market prices for 
similar assets or liabilities in active markets; quoted prices for identical or 
similar assets or liabilities in markets that are not active; and model-derived 
valuations whose inputs are observable or whose significant value drivers are 
observable.</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="9%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Level 3:</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="70%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Pricing inputs are unobservable
for the assets and liabilities, including situations in which there is little to
no market activity.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: darkgray" noshade size="3">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 9pt"><a href="#TOC"><!--EFPlaceholder--><font

</div>
</div>
<br>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Fair values assigned to the 
Company&#8217;s acquired fixed assets were determined using Level 2, and the 
fair value associated with the Company&#8217;s intangible asset was based on 
Level 3 inputs.&#160;&#160;The inputs used to determine fair value require 
significant management judgment and estimation.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; 
DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Research 
and Development Costs</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Research and development costs 
are charged to expense as incurred.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; 
DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Stock 
Based Compensation</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">FASB ASC 718 requires that 
measurement of the cost of employee services received in exchange for an award 
of equity instruments be based on the grant-date fair value of the award. Such 
costs are recorded over the periods employees are required to render services in
exchange for the awards.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; 
DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Income 
taxes</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Deferred tax assets and 
liabilities are recognized for the estimated future tax consequences 
attributable to temporary differences between the financial statement carrying 
amounts of existing assets and liabilities and their respective tax bases. These
assets and liabilities are measured using enacted tax rates expected to apply to
taxable income in the years in which the temporary differences are expected to 
reverse.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">We have net operating loss 
carryforwards available to reduce future taxable income. Future tax benefits for
these net operating loss carryforwards are recognized to the extent that 
realization of these benefits is considered more likely than not. To the extent 
that we will not realize a future tax benefit, a valuation allowance is 
established.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Basic and 
diluted net loss per share</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Basic loss per share is 
computed using the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding
during each period. Diluted loss per share includes the dilutive effects of 
common stock equivalents on an &#8220;as if converted&#8221; basis. For the 
years ended 2012, potential dilutive securities had an anti-dilutive effect and 
were not included in the calculation of diluted net loss per common 
share</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Recent 
Accounting Pronouncements</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The Company does not expect the
adoption of recently issued accounting pronouncements to have a significant 
impact on the Company&#8217;s results of operation, financial position or cash 
flows.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Unaudited 
Financial Statements</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The accompanying unaudited 
financial statements for the three months ended June 30, 2012 have been prepared
in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles for interim 
financia1 information.&#160;&#160;In the opinion of management all adjustments 
considered necessary for a fair presentation, which consist of normal recurring 
adjustments, have been included.&#160;&#160;The accompanying financial 
statements should be read in conjunction with the financial statements and notes
thereto included in the Company&#8217;s March 31, 2012 Annual Report on Form 10-
K.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>

balance sheet arrangements that have or are reasonably likely to have a current 
or future material effect on our financial condition, changes in financial 
condition, revenues or expenses, results of operations, liquidity, capital 
expenditures or capital resources.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>

stock is traded under the symbol &#8220;EXNT&#8221; on the NASD OTC Bulletin 
Board, and the symbol &#8220;AOHMDW&#8221; on the Frankfurt, Berlin and 
Stuttgart Stock Exchanges in Germany. There can be no assurance that an active 
or regular trading market for the common stock will develop or that, if 
developed, will be sustained. Various factors, such as operating results, 
changes in laws, rules or regulations, general market fluctuations, changes in 
financial estimates by securities analysts and other factors may have a 
significant</font></div>

4.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
CONTROL AND PROCEDURES.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Evaluation of Disclosure 
Controls and Procedures. Our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer
have concluded, based on their evaluation as of the end of the period covered by
this report, that our disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Rules 
13(a)-15(e) under the Securities Act of 1934, as amended) are effective to 
ensure that all information required to be disclosed by us in the reports filed 
or submitted by us under the Securities and Exchange Act is recorded, processed,
summarized and reported within the time periods specified in the SEC&#8217;s 
rules and forms, and include controls and procedures designed to ensure that 
information required to be disclosed by us in such reports is accumulated and 
communicated to the&#160;&#160;management, including the Chief Executive Officer
and the Chief Financial Officer, as appropriate and allow timely decisions 
regarding required disclosure.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Changes in Internal 
Controls.<font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font>In 
connection with the above-referenced evaluation, no change in our internal 
control over financial reporting occurred during the period covered by this 
report that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially 
affect, our internal control over financial reporting.</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>

litigation at this time. &#160;We may from time to time be&#160;a party to 
various legal actions in the ordinary course of business.&#160; There can be no 
assurance that the Company will not be a party to litigation in the future that 
could have an adverse effect on the Company.</font></div>

bold">SARBANES-OXLEY SECTION 302(a) CERTIFICATION</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">I, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">Ryan Corley</font>, certify that:</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY:

</td>
<td align="left" colspan="2" valign="top" width="84%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY:

</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new

<td colspan="2" valign="top" width="84%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">2.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" colspan="2" valign="top" width="84%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Based on my knowledge, this report does
not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material 
fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under 
which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period 
covered by this report;</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td colspan="2" valign="top" width="84%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-

</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">3.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" colspan="2" valign="top" width="84%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY:

statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly 
present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations 
and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this 
report;</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new

<td colspan="2" valign="top" width="84%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-

</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">4.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" colspan="2" valign="top" width="84%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The registrant&#8217;s other certifying
officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure 
controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-
15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td colspan="2" valign="top" width="84%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">a.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="81%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Designed such disclosure controls and 
procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed 
under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the 
registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by 
others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this 
report is being prepared;</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="81%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">b.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="81%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Designed such internal control over 
financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to
be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the
reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements 
for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting 
principles;</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="81%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">c.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="81%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Evaluated the effectiveness of the 
registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this 
report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and 
procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such 
evaluation; and</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="81%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">d.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="81%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Disclosed in this report any change in 
the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred 
during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s
fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially 
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s 
internal control over financial reporting; and</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="81%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">5.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" colspan="2" valign="top" width="84%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The registrant&#8217;s other certifying
officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal 
control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the 
audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons 
performing the equivalent functions):</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td colspan="2" valign="top" width="84%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">a.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="81%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">All significant deficiencies and 
material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over 
financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the
registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial 
information; and</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="81%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">b.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="81%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Any fraud, whether or not material, 
that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the 
registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:

</td>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:

</td>

</td>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:

</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new

</td>
<td align="left" colspan="2" valign="top" width="81%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:

officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure 
controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-
15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td colspan="2" valign="top" width="81%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">a.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Designed such disclosure controls and 
procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed 
under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the 
registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by 
others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this 
report is being prepared;</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>

</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">b.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY:
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Designed such internal control over 
financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to
be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the
reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements 
for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting 
principles;</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new

<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">c.</font></div>

registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this

evaluation; and</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new

</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">d.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Disclosed in this report any change in 
the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred 
during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s
fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially 
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s 
internal control over financial reporting; and</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">5.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" colspan="2" valign="top" width="81%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The registrant&#8217;s other certifying
officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal 
control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the 
audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons

</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td colspan="2" valign="top" width="81%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-

<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">a.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">All significant deficiencies and 
material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over 
financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the 
registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial 
information; and</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="78%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">b.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="78%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: 
times new roman, serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Any fraud, whether or not material, 
that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the 
registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>

<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="39%">
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT:

gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureText
Block contextRef="c2_From1Apr2011To30Jun2012">&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 
12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold&quot;&gt;NOTE&#xd;
      1 - BASIS OF PRESENTATION&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; 
align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 11pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      accompanying unaudited financial statements of EnXnet, Inc.&#xd;
      (&amp;#8220;EnXnet&amp;#8221; or &amp;#8220;the Company&amp;#8221;) for 
the&#xd;
      three months ended June 30, 2012 have been prepared in&#xd;
      accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in&#xd;
      the United States of America, pursuant to the rules and&#xd;
      regulations of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Comission&#xd;
      (the &amp;#8220;SEC&amp;#8221;) for interim financia1&#xd;
      information.&amp;#160;Accordingly, the financial statements do&#xd;
      not include all information and footnotes required by&#xd;
      generally accepted accounting principles in the United States&#xd;
      (&amp;#8220;GAAP&amp;#8221;) for complete annual financial&#xd;
      statements.&amp;#160;In the opinion of management, the&#xd;
      accompanying unaudited condensed interim financial statements&#xd;
      reflect all adjustments, consisting of normal recurring&#xd;
      adjustments, considered necessary for a fair&#xd;
      presentation.&amp;#160;The accompanying financial statements&#xd;
      should be read in conjunction with the financial statements&#xd;
      and notes thereto included in the Company&amp;#8217;s March 31,&#xd;
      2012 Annual Report on Form 10-K.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;</us-
